poem:
"Ode to the Unfound Tradesman"

Online tabs promise tradesman true,
To mend and seal the rain-swept roof.
Yet, blackened under peacock-blue,
Stands a house that's lost its proof.
Her savings drained on promises poor,
Tears make rivers of Brighton stone.
On the lip of hope secure,
She whispers, "I am not alone." 
In this digital wilderness grown,
Trust should be more than a loan.
